title: Panel, ca. 1600
medium:
Medium: linen
Technique: grid of withdrawn element work with needle lace, reticella style
provenance: This was previously in the collection of Madame Jules Porges. See research folder.
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Panel of lace with three horizontal bands divided into eight squares each, depicting scenes from the biblical story in which Judith severs Holoferne's head to save her people. With geometric edging on three sides; cut on the right.

exhibitions.title: Shahzia Sikander Selects: Works from the Permanent Collection

tombstone.epitaph:

ca. 1600. Medium: linen
